We are pleased to announced that a whopping 367 modERN datasets have just been released in the ENCODE portal.

Image Collection Landing Page

111 Annotation File Sets of promoter-like and enhancer-like regions have been released! More information on how the DAC called these enhancer-like and promoter-like regions can be found under Encyclopedia, about page. You can also go directly to the DAC websites: Methods for calling Enhancer-like Regions and Methods for calling Promoter-like Regions.

name: release-annotation-file-sets
title: Release of Annotation File Sets
news_excerpt: 111 Annotation File Sets of promoter-like and enhancer-like regions have been released!

title: 336 Annotation File Sets Released
name: 336-annotation-file-sets-released
news_excerpt: With collaborations from the DAC (Data Analysis Center), a total of 336 Annotation File Sets of promoter-like and enhancer-like regions have been released!

blocks.body:
With collaborations from the DAC (Data Analysis Center), a total of 336 Annotation File Sets of promoter-like and enhancer-like regions have been released! More information on how the DAC called these enhancer-like and promoter-like regions can be found under Encyclopedia, about page. You can also go directly to the DAC websites: Methods for calling Enhancer-like Regions and Methods for calling Promoter-like Regions.

The DAC's code repository for promoter-like and enhancer-like regions are found here. Huge thank you to Michael Purcaro and Jill Moore for the help.

blocks.body: Abstract deadline for talk consideration at the 2016 ENCODE Users Meeting is May 16, 2016. Register and submit abstract here!

title: 2016 ENCODE Users Meeting
name: 2016-encode-users-meeting
news_excerpt: We’re happy to announce the second annual ENCODE Users Meeting.

blocks.body:
We are happy to announce that the second annual ENCODE Users Meeting will be held at Stanford University on June 8th-10th, 2016.

More details at www.encode2016.org

title: January 2017 Data Release Overview

blocks.body:
We are pleased to announce that 393 new datasets were released in the month of January. The assays range from ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq, and various forms of RNA-seq; these datasets come from human (264), mouse (43), and fruit fly (86).

These datasets are free and accessible for download on the ENCODE portal, no logins required.

news_excerpt: 393 new datasets were released in the month of January
name: 2017-02-03-january-release

news_excerpt: We are pleased to announce that the Garber Lab, under the GGR project, has released 66 new dendritic cell datasets.

blocks.body:
We are pleased to announce that the Garber Lab, under the Genomics of Gene Regulation project, has released 66 new dendritic cell datasets. These datasets come from ATAC-seq, RNA-seq, and ChIP-seq, providing great look into the genomic and transcriptomic landscape of the dendritic cell. Eleven of these are mouse, 55 are human datasets. 

The ENCODE DCC would like to remind all that these 66 datasets are free and accessible for use here on the ENCODE portal, no logins required.

name: 2017-01-20-garber-lab-release
title: Data Release: 66 new dendritic cell datasets from the Garber Lab

blocks.body:
We are pleased to announce that the modERN project has released 86 new Drosophila melanogaster ChIP-seq data (includes control experiments). Their processed files have been visualized in both dm3 and dm6 genome references, and includes the processing pipelines, steps, and QC metrics.

Please contact us at encode-help@lists.stanford.edu for any questions regarding these datasets.

news_excerpt: We are pleased to announce that the modERN project has released 86 new Drosophila ChIP-seq data.
title: Data Release: 86 Drosophila ChIP-seq data
name: 2017-01-11-modern-drosophila-chipseq

news_excerpt: We are pleased to announce that the Reddy Lab has released 48 new ChIP-seq experiments.
name: 2016-12-20-new-chipseq-data
title: December releases: 48 ChIP-seq from the Reddy Lab

blocks.body:
We are pleased to announce that the Reddy Lab has released 48 new ChIP-seq experiments. These ChIP-seq experiments were assayed on immortalized cell ine A549, treated with dexamethasone, and each transcription factor has a control per time treatment. 

Treatment Time Series
CTCF: ENCSR738NGQ
JUN: ENCSR588JLN
JUNB: ENCSR483SDK
Control: ENCSR678VDY

title: Regarding new eCLIP processed data

blocks.body:
The Yeo Lab and the ENCODE DCC have released new eCLIP processed files. These new bed, bigBed, and bigWig files include a supersedes property within its metadata to indicate which file it has replaced. Dr. Eric Van Nostrad (Yeo Lab) has provided the following statement in regards to the replacement:

“We improved the peak calling background detection to avoid issues of false negatives at a specific class of RNAs with short introns. There are very few old peaks that are not found in the new version (i.e., were few false positives in the old set); but there are some datasets with substantially increased number of peaks."

Please contact the ENCODE DCC help desk for any questions.

news_excerpt: The Yeo Lab and the ENCODE DCC have released new eCLIP processed files.
name: 2016-12-07-new-eclip-data

news_excerpt: ENCODE Users Meeting 2016 presentations are on youtube.

blocks.body:
Happy Monday!

We are excited to announce that the ENCODE Users Meeting presentations have been uploaded onto the NHGRI Youtube channel. See all of them HERE. The ENCODE DCC Outreach group will also contact all users who partook in this event to direct them to the videos, and will link each presentation to their respective tutorials in our tutorials page.

Cheers,
ENCODE DCC

*Note: Dr. Freedman requested the ENCODE Consortium to not put his own slides or presentation in our tutorial page.

news_excerpt: 72 ChIP-seq experiments from the Reddy Lab (Genomics of Gene Regulation project) have been released to the public.
name: 2016-10-27-ggr-chipseq
title: 72 GGR ChIP-seq from the Reddy Lab released!

blocks.body: We are pleased to announce that 72 ChIP-seq experiments from the Reddy Lab (Duke University), part of the Genomics of Gene Regulation project, have been released to the public. All ChIP-seq experiments were done on A549 cell line biosamples and 66 were treated with dexamethasone. You can explore all of them here. For more information about the Genomics of Gene Regulation, read here. For more information about the Reddy Lab, read here.

blocks.body: We are pleased to announce the first release on the ENCODE portal of Hi-C data, from Job Dekker's lab.  We have released the fastq files and associated metadata, and look forward to hosting analysis and visualization files soon.

More details at www.encode2016.org

news_excerpt: The second annual ENCODE Users Meeting will be held at Stanford University!
name: 2016-03-22-users-meeting

news_excerpt: The Roadmap Epigenomics Mapping Consortium (Roadmap) metadata has been fully incorporated into this site including the standardization of terms and ontologies.

blocks.body:
The Roadmap Epigenomics Mapping Consortium (Roadmap) metadata has been fully incorporated into this site including the standardization of terms and ontologies. The experimental metadata can now be searched and explored alongside the ENCODE data. However, the raw data is still housed at dbGAP and the hg19 processed data is housed at GEO. Each Roadmap experiment has a link to the corresponding GEO submission.

We are pleased to announce that 3127 Roadmap experiments have been released on the ENCODE Portal including:

  • ChIP-seq: 1884 experiments
  • Dnase-seq: 373 experiments
  • RNA-seq: 345 experiments
  • shotgun bisulfite-seq assay (WGBS): 145 experiments

name: 2015-10-06-roadmap
title: Roadmap Epigenomics metadata integrated

news_excerpt: Includes RNA Bind-n-Seq, ChIP-seq, RNA-seq, and WGBS assays
name: 2015-06-23-data-release
title: Data release: 3 human and 91 mouse datasets

blocks.body:
We are pleased to announce that the following datasets have been released on the ENCODE Portal:

  • Human: 3 RNA Bind-n-Seq ssays
  • Mouse: 64 ChIP-Seq, 15 RNA-seq, 12 whole genome bisulfite sequencing ssays

These data, along with other released ENCODE data, are available at the ENCODE Portal. Recently released data can be identified by selecting a month under the "Date released" filter. View data from this current release.

The new data are released under a rapid release policy by which primary data (e.g., fastq sequence files) are released immediately after validation to data formatting standards. Processed data from these experiments will be released after quality assessment and uniform processing are complete. Unlike the previous ENCODE production phase, there is no moratorium on external use for these data.

news_excerpt: To improve transparency about the changes to the objects that comprise the ENCODE metadata schema, we are publishing changelogs for each object
name: 2015-05-28-changelogs
title: Changelogs

blocks.body:
A key feature of the ENCODE Portal is the ability to programmatically query metadata and URLs to files via the REST API. To improve transparency about the changes to the objects that comprise the ENCODE metadata schema, we are publishing changelogs for each object. To view the changelog, replace the following URL with the object name:

https://www.encodeproject.org/profiles/changelogs/[object_name].md

For example, viewing the changelog for the file.json object would be

https://www.encodeproject.org/profiles/changelogs/file.md

We are pleased to announce that the following datasets have been released on the ENCODE Portal:

  • Human:16 RAMPAGE, 12 RNA Bind-n-Seq assays

These data, along with other released ENCODE data, are available at the ENCODE Portal. Recently released data can be identified by selecting a month under the "Date released" filter. View data from this current release.

The new data are released under a rapid release policy by which primary data (e.g., fastq sequence files) are released immediately after validation to data formatting standards. Processed data from these experiments will be released after quality assessment and uniform processing are complete. Unlike the previous ENCODE production phase, there is no moratorium on external use for these data.

title: Mouse ENCODE Consortium papers published
news_excerpt: Recent findings from the mouse ENCODE Consortium are now published
name: 2014-11-19-mouse-publications

blocks.body: Recent findings from the mouse ENCODE Consortium investigating the genomic elements in the mouse model organism and its comparison to human are now published. The list of publications and data used in these publications are detailed on the supplemental website.

title: Data release: 23 human and 5 mouse datasets
news_excerpt: These datasets are from ChIP-seq, iCLIP, RAMPAGE, RNA-seq, and WGBS assays
name: 2014-09-12-data-release

blocks.body:
We are pleased to announce that the following datasets have been released on the ENCODE Portal:

  • Human: 16 ChIP-seq, 4 iCLIP, and 3 RAMPAGE
  • Mouse: 4 RNA-seq and 1 Shotgun Bisulfite-seq

This release includes a new assay:

  • iCLIP (individual-nucleotide resolution UV-cross-linking and immunoprecipitation): identifies the binding site of RNA-binding proteins at individual nucleotide resolution (PMID: 20601959, PMID: 2155900)

These data, along with other released ENCODE data, are available at the ENCODE Portal. Recently released data can be identified by selecting a month under the "Date released" filter. View data from this current release.

The new data are released under a rapid release policy by which primary data (e.g., fastq sequence files) are released immediately after validation to data formatting standards. Processed data from these experiments will be released after quality assessment and uniform processing are complete. Unlike the previous ENCODE production phase, there is no moratorium on external use for these data.

Read the new data release policy.
